dischargeDispositionCode.displayName: Discharged to home or self care (routine discharge)

list.item:
Encounter Diagnosis
Hypertensive disorder, systemic arterial (disorder)

Clinical Note
Patient vital signs were stable as documented throughout shift on 2L Oxygen via nasal cannula. His lungs are diminished with scattered crackles. Bowel sounds are active and the patient had a bowel movement x 2 today, both soft. Incontinent of urine and wearing a diaper. Skin intact at this time. Skin color is pale. 2+ non-pitting edema noted in bilateral calves and ankles. Assessed patient and reconciled medications. Spoke with daughter who has power of attorney, to provide updates and education on the patient's condition. Laboratory obtained morning labs without problem and vascular therapy placed a new 18g peripheral IV as the previous one was due for a change. Patient took all morning meds without problem. Reoriented patient and provided opportunities for toileting and for making needs known every 1-2 hours today to lessen risk of fall.
